title: Spaceman1000$
author: Spaceman1000$
content: The federal executive council has approved the use of Blockchain technology in Nigeria.This is another plus for the crypto currency in the country, as companies can now develop various means of its usage for it's framework.A committee has also been set up to oversee the implementation of the new national policy on Blockchain technology. This one na good thing for we country oh, this one go help us develop our local based knowledge on Blockchain technology.My people how Una see am?https://twitter.com/toluogunlesi/status/1653769481691299840?t=WpNGXuNcW5cpTm3GlO1D0w&s=19

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Was eNaira not created with the use of blockchain technology? They said it was. comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: @Spaceman1000$Maybe you can add this link: https://twitter.com/FMoCDENigeria/status/1653846759779475458?s=20Quote from: https://twitter.com/FMoCDENigeria/status/1653846759779475458?s=20The activities of the Policy shall be coordinated by the National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA), under the supervision of the Federal Ministry of Communications and Digital Economy. A multi-sectoral Steering Committee has also been approved to oversee the implementation of the Policy.The Federal Executive Council has further directed relevant regulatory bodies to develop regulatory instruments for the deployment of Blockchain Technology across various sectors of the economy.  These regulatory agencies include NITDA, the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), the National Universities Commission (NUC), the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC), among others.All other Federal and State Government institutions, as well as the private sector are urged to leverage Blockchain Technologies in education, health, security, agriculture and finance, among many other sectors.  Deploying these applications will further support in the implementation of the National Digital Economy Policy and Strategy for a Digital Nigeria.We all know that CBN has already started this with the creation of eNaira, but there are other areas that CBN can still make use of blockchain technology. This is not related (or directly related) to bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies, but I think it is a good move to raise awareness for the regulatory bodies as well as federal and state institutes to make use of blockchain technology which is the way to the future.
